body_html: I have succeeded in compiling a GPU, Python 3.5 version of TensorFlow 0.10.0 on a CentOS 6 Docker, and it ran well on our university's CentOS 6 cluster. Check https://github.com/leelabcnbc/DevOps/tree/master/Docker. Basically, it's replacing some hardcoded lines in CROSSTOOL-related items, and adding -lm to everything to prevent errors like #2291. I think Google can make compiling TensorFlow on CentOS less frustrating, if they make some hardcoded stuff link to correct locations.

body: I have succeeded in compiling a GPU, Python 3.5 version of TensorFlow 0.10.0 on a CentOS 6 Docker, and it ran well on our university's CentOS 6 cluster. Check https://github.com/leelabcnbc/DevOps/tree/master/Docker. Basically, it's replacing some hardcoded lines in CROSSTOOL-related items, and adding `-lm` to everything to prevent errors like #2291. I think Google can make compiling TensorFlow on CentOS less frustrating, if they make some hardcoded stuff link to correct locations.
